p: Five naturally SIV-infected SMs (Table 1) were sampled three times over a 2-year period. Viral RNA in plasma obtained in 3/99, 5/99, and 5/01 was measured by a real-time RT-PCR assay designed to quantitatively detect the diverse SIVsm variants [ 23]. Time points were chosen so that evolution could be assessed over both shorter and longer time intervals. Viral load averaged 1.5 Ã— 10 6 SIV RNA copies/ml plasma, and fluctuated modestly over the 2-year period (Figure 1). No clinical signs of AIDS were observed in any of the infected SMs over the study period.
